Input Projectors

List of implemented input_projectors classes, submodule of EntityTypingNetwork

class entity_typing_framework.EntityTypingNetwork_classes.projectors.Classifier(name, type_number, input_dim, layers_parameters)

Projector used as classification layer after the Encoder. Predicts a vector with shape (type_number) with values between 0 and 1.

Parameters:
name:

the name of the submodule, has to be specified in the yaml configuration file with key model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.name

to instance this projector insert the string Classifier in the yaml configuration file with key model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.name

this param is used by the Entity Typing Network to instance the correct submodule

type_number:

number of types in the dataset for this run, it is automatically extracted by the DatasetManager and automatically given in input to the Classifier by the Entity Typing Network

input_dim:

dimension of the vector inputed for the forward, it is automatically extracted from the Encoder by the Entity Typing Network

parameters:

dictionary of parameters to instantiate different Layer objects.

the values for this parameter have to be specified in a yaml dictionary in the yaml configuration file with key model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.layers_parameters

see the documentation of Layer for the format of these parameters

add_parameters()

adds the default parameters if are not specified into the yaml configuration file under the key model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.layers_parameters

The default values are:

  • if input features of the 0th projection layer are not specified or it is specified the string encoder_dim, the value input_dim is inserted by default

  • if output features of the last proection layer are not specificied or it is specified the string type_number: the value type_number is inserted by default

check_parameters()

Check the parameters values and raises exceptions. Ensure that a classic classification can be obtained.

forward(input_representation)

operates the forward pass of this submodule, proecting the encoded input in a vector of confidence values (one for each type in the dataset)

parameters:
input_representation:

output of the Input Encoder with shape [input_dim, batch_size]

output:

classification vector with shape [type_number, batch_size]

class entity_typing_framework.EntityTypingNetwork_classes.projectors.Layer(in_features, out_features, activation='relu', use_dropout=True, dropout_p=0.1, use_batch_norm=False)

Fully Connected Layer with activation function, with parametrization managed through the yaml configuration file under the key model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.layer_id

Each layer has an incremental id specified in the yaml configuration file, which works as index in the dictionary (see the example configuration files)

Parameters:
in_features:

dimension of the input features of the fully connected layer

out_features:

dimension of the output features of the fully connected layer

activation:

the activation function to use; supported activations are relu and sigmoid

use_dropout:

if use the dropout or not

dropout_p:

probability of dropout

use_batch_norm:

if use the batch normalization or not

forward(hidden_representation)

Performs the forward pass for the fully connected layer.

Parameters:
hidden representation:

a tensor with shape [in_features, batch_size]

Output:

output of the forward pass and the activation with shape [out_features, batch_size]

instance_activation(activation_name)

instances the activation function. This procedure is driven by the yaml configuration file

parameters:
activation name:

name of the activation function to use, specified in the key: model.ET_Network_params.input_projector_params.layer_id.activation of the yaml configuration file

supported value : ['relu', 'sigmoid']
